required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors for Mortality for COVID-19 Admitted to an Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Characteristics & Risk Factors for Mortality of COVID-19 Patients Admitted Into Intensive Care Unit in Hospital Queen Elizabeth

brief_summary.textblock: Studying clinical characterization of critically ill COVID-19 patients in a single center Studying Risk factors for Day 28 Mortality in COVID-19 patients admitted to intensive care unit

detailed_description.textblock: An observational study looking into clinical characterization of the novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in patients admitted, critically ill, into Intensive Care Unit of Hospital Queen Elizabeth between 1st October 2020 until 31st January 2021. Analysis also would be looking into the risk factors into Day 28 mortality of these patients

primary_outcome.description: Died before or on Day 28 after ICU admission

secondary_outcome.description: Requirement of oxygen supplementation on day 28 after icu admission

arm_group.description: Participants who had Critically-ill COVID-19 and admitted to the Intensive Care Unit which died before or on day 28 post ICU admission
Participants who had Critically-ill COVID-19 and admitted to the Intensive Care Unit whom are still alive on day 28 post ICU admission

intervention.description: No intervention as this study is a Retrospective Cohort Observational

study_pop.textblock: All patients admitted to the ICU in Hospital Queen Elizabeth, Kota Kinabalu between 1st October 2020 until 31st January 2021, which confirmed to have via PCR testing or Rapid Test Antigen are positive for PCR

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients admitted to the ICU in Hospital Queen Elizabeth, Kota Kinabalu between 1st October 2020 until 31st January 2021
- Confirmed COVID-19 Positive using RT-PCR or RTK-Ag either before or during admission in ICU
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that were admitted in ICU suspected to have COVID-19 and died in ICU which subsequently to be COVID-19 negative
